reference.title: eucadw-generate-report
reference.shortdesc: Generates a report from the data warehouse.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: eucadw-generate-report -p password[filename] [-t report_type] [-f report_format] [-s start_date] [-e end_date] [--size-unit size_unit] [--time-unit time_unit] [--size-time-size-unit size_time_size_unit] [--size-time-time-unit size_time_time_unit] [-d] [-F]

row.entry: Administrator password you configured in the data warehouse installation.
Name of the file to output report data to. If you do not enter a filename, Eucalyptus generates report data to the console.

Type of report to generate.
Valid values: elastic-ip | instance | s3 | snapshot | volume
Default: instance

Format of report generate.
Valid values: csv | html
Default: html

Inclusive start date for the exported data in YYYY-MM-DD format. For example, 2012-08-19.
Default: html
Exclusive end date for the exported data in YYYY-MM-DD format. For example, 2012-08-26.

The level of granularity for reporting metrics by size alone.
Valid values: b | kb | mb | gb
Default: gb

The level of granularity for reporting interval.
Valid values: seconds | minutes | hours | days
Default: days

The level of granularity for reporting size metrics for the time interval.
Valid values: b | kb | mb | gb
Default: gb

The level of granularity for reporting size metrics for the time interval.
Valid values: seconds | minutes | hours | days
Default: DAYS
Include event dependencies from outside the requested time period.
Overwrite output file if it exists.

section.title: Output
section.p: Eucalyptus returns a message stating that report was generated to the file you specified.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: eucadw-generate-report -s 2012-11-05 -e 2012-11-07 --size-unit=b --size-time-size-unit=b -t instance Report2.html -p mypassword Exported data to Report2.html
